content: British colonial administrator **Sir John Fearns Nicoll** [KCMG](/wiki/Knight_Commander_of_the_Order_of_St_Michael_and_St_George) [KStJ](/wiki/Knight_of_Justice_of_the_Order_of_St_John) (26 April 1899 – 12 January 1981) was a British colonial administrator who served as [Governor of Singapore](/wiki/Governor_of_Singapore) from 1952 to 1955. ## Early years and colonial service Nicoll was born in 1899 and attended [Carlisle Grammar School](/wiki/Carlisle_Grammar_School), [Pembroke College, Oxford](/wiki/Pembroke_College,_Oxford) and [University of Oxford](/wiki/University_of_Oxford) and embarked on a colonial career in [British Protectorate of North Borneo](/wiki/North_Borneo) in 1921. Nicoll became Deputy Colonial Secretary of the British Crown Colony [Trinidad and Tobago](/wiki/Trinidad_and_Tobago) in 1937, the Colonial Secretary of the British Colony of [Fiji](/wiki/Fiji) from 1944 to 1949. During this time, he served as [Acting Governor](/wiki/Governor_of_Fiji) twice, in 1944 and 1947. This was followed by his appointment as administrator and Colonial Secretary of Hong Kong in 1949. Nicoll became Governor of Singapore in 1952 and was present during the [1954 National Service riots](/wiki/1954_National_Service_riots). After the [Hock Lee bus riots](/wiki/Hock_Lee_bus_riots) in May 1955, Nicoll retired from the Governorship and Colonial Service in June. He returned to [Britain](/wiki/United_Kingdom). ## Awards and honours Nicoll was invested as Companion of the [Order of St Michael and St George](/wiki/Order_of_St_Michael_and_St_George) (CMG) in the [1946 New Year Honours](/wiki/1946_New_Year_Honours) and was promoted to Knight Commander of the Order of St Michael and St George (KCMG) in [1953 New Year Honours](/wiki/1953_New_Year_Honours). He was knighted with [Order of the Hospital of Saint John of Jerusalem](/wiki/Knight_of_Justice_of_the_Order_of_St_John) (KStJ) in 1952. ## Personal Nicoll and his wife, Irene, had one son, Anthony Nicoll. Nicoll died on 12 January 1981 at [Scio House Hospital](/wiki/Scio_House_Hospital), [Putney Heath](/wiki/Wimbledon_Common), [London](/wiki/London), [United Kingdom](/wiki/United_Kingdom). ## Legacy [Nicoll Highway](/wiki/Nicoll_Highway) was named in his honour and a portrait of Nicoll by [Elliott & Fry](/wiki/Elliott_%26_Fry) hangs in the [National Portrait Gallery](/wiki/National_Portrait_Gallery,_London). - Chua, Alvin (6 July 2009). "Sir John Fearns Nicoll". *Singapore Infopedia*. National Library Board Singapore. Retrieved 17 August 2010.
